alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 16 at 4:18AM EDT until September 16 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...A reasonable worst case of up to 1 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northwest Suffolk, Northeast Suffolk and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Some roads and low lying properties including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 3 to 5 ft will result in beach erosion, minor damage possible to dune structures, and splashover seawalls and bulkheads. This will locally exacerbate shoreline flooding, particularly in more exposed areas such as Orient Point. * FORECAST CHALLENGES...There is still uncertainty in the timing of peak surge relative to the times of high tide today, the magnitude of wave setup effects over several tidal cycles, and the fact that Lee is moving to the northeast of the region. For these reasons, this coastal flood forecast represents a reasonable worst case forecast.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk
